title: Ebay stock falls after weak outlook; update on StubHub to come before next earnings
text: EBay Inc. EBAY, +0.67% shares fell more than 2.5% in the extended session Wednesday after the company issued below-consensus fourth-quarter revenue guidance and said it would have an update on StubHub before the next earnings release. The e-commerce company reported third-quarter net income of $310 million, or 37 cents a share, compared with $721 million, or 73 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Adjusted earnings were 67 cents a share. Revenue was flat at $2.65 billion, compared to the year-ago period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had estimated adjusted earnings of 64 cents a share on revenue of $2.65 billion. Former Chief Executive Devin Wenig resigned from eBay amid an activist fight in September; Elliott Management and Starboard Financial are pressuring eBay to spin off StubHub and Classifieds, a move that Wenig disagreed with. In its financial release, eBay said it would have an update on the StubHub business before the next earnings release. For the fourth quarter, analysts model adjusted earnings of 76 cents and sales of $2.85 billion. EBay said it expects adjusted earnings of 73 cents to 76 cents a share on sales of $2.77 billion to $2.82 billion. EBay stock has gained 40% this year, with the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.28% rising 20%.
